Company Description

We welcome fearless thinkers.  

For over 100 years, Maurice Blackburn has stood up for those who need us most. With courage and compassion, we extend access to justice to countless Australians. We look beyond the immediate challenge to support people in moments that matter across their lives and continually push for better solutions for our clients. We invest in and empower our people to stand up for what we believe in and go fearlessly forward together. 

We work on real cases, achieving important and positive results in real people’s lives, which is why we are one of Australia’s most respected law firms. Maurice Blackburn, experience you can count on.  

About the role 

Join #TeamMB as a Senior Insights Analyst in our Digital & Technology team, where you’ll help shape the future of data-driven decision making across the firm. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to design and deliver meaningful insights, support the rollout of our new Legal Services Platform, and contribute to the development of user-friendly dashboards and reporting tools. This is a great opportunity to bring your analytical mindset and storytelling skills to a collaborative team focused on improving client and employee experiences. 

What we’re looking for 

Extensive experience in data analysis, data product development, or data management, with a proven track record of delivering strategic insights that drive business outcomes
A deep passion for data storytelling, with the ability to craft compelling, user-centric visualisations that influence decision-making at all levels
Advanced SQL skills for querying and manipulating large, complex datasets, including performance optimisation and data pipeline design
Proficiency in business intelligence platforms such as Power BI and Qlik, with experience in developing scalable dashboards and reporting frameworks
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence), and experience contributing to iterative delivery cycles
A strong grasp of data architecture and engineering principles, including data sourcing, storage, transformation, and output strategies
The ability to translate ambiguous business problems into analytical frameworks, identify key metrics, and design impactful solutions
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strategic mindset and meticulous attention to detail
Outstanding communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to present complex insights to senior, non-technical audiences
A proactive and consultative approach, with a focus on continuous improvement, innovation, and delivering high-quality outcomes
A commitment to data governance, quality assurance, and best practices in data management
Experience working collaboratively across cross-functional teams, while also being comfortable leading initiatives independently

Team MB Benefits: 

Ongoing coaching and career development opportunities  
End of Year leave, 1 day first year, 4 days after 2 years 
Comprehensive mental health framework, including wellbeing leave (up to 4 extra days per year) and $299 reimbursement 
22 Weeks Parental leave with your superannuation guaranteed and back-to-work transition policy 
Rewards and recognition platform with fitness, retail, and entertainment discounts 
A hybrid flex working model 
Salary Continuance & Life Insurance 
17.5% Annual Leave Loading 

… just to name a few. *T's & C's apply

Additional Information

Our shared values represent what we stand for and guide how we act, with Courage; Compassion; Collaboration; Fairness and Tenacity. 

We love that you have a life outside of work and we’re happy to support yours. We provide you a safe, supportive and collaborative environment, backed by inclusive leaders and progressive people policies, where you can be your authentic self and thrive. Here we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture, enriched by differences in ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, religion, age and family arrangements. Applications from First Nations People are encouraged. 

Are you ready to join us on a journey to extend access to justice to more Australians, in an organisation and role in which every action you take makes a difference? Apply now. 

Our Circle Back Initiative partnership means we’re committed to responding to every applicant. 

Please note that all successful candidates will be required to undergo background checks as part of our commitment to maintaining a safe and compliant workplace

Join a fast-growing and innovative organisation as they harness data to drive smarter decision-making across the business. This is your opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping data strategy and delivering advanced analytics solutions that make a real impact.
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will take ownership of designing, building, and maintaining robust data pipelines and reporting frameworks, influencing and deciding how projects are run and delivered. These projects range from customer behaviour segmentation and predictive modelling to advanced geo-location insights, helping the business deliver tailored and effective strategies.

What you'll be responsible for:
Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and reporting systems in GCP (BigQuery and Python).
Driving advanced analytics initiatives, including customer behavioural segmentation, predictive modelling, and recommendation systems.
Developing proprietary planning tools to surface insights from user behaviour data.
Creating advanced location-based analytics using GIS data sets and tools.
Implementing monitoring dashboards to detect and resolve scheduling or system errors proactively.
Applying advanced statistical methods to identify patterns and deliver actionable insights for strategic decision-making.
Collaborating with engineers and leadership to enhance data governance and promote best practices across the organisation.
What you'll bring to the role

Proven expertise in BigQuery and Python is a must.
Strong track record of leading data projects or teams from concept to delivery.
Exposure to advertising or media analytics is highly desirable.
Deep experience with big data tools, API integration, and scalable data solutions.
Proficiency in data visualisation platforms like Looker Studio, Power BI, or Tableau.
Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to influence senior leaders.
A strategic mindset with a strong attention to detail and the ability to juggle multiple priorities effectively.

We will understand your priorities, whether financial, career progression, workplace culture or technology-related. We will discuss the opportunity thoroughly, how it aligns with your career goals, and guide you through the recruitment process, providing expert advice and support from the initial application to the offer.
We are trusted advisors to our clients, acting as an extension of their business.
We genuinely care about our candidates and love helping connect people with great opportunities. If you would like to understand more about the above role, please do get in touch.
   
Our Values
Humanity – Success – Integrity – Accountability – Curiosity
   
Diversity – Welcome it. Entrust it. Celebrate it.

Within our business, we have created an environment where anyone from any background can bring their authentic self to work, celebrating our differences whilst working towards a common purpose. We believe this is not just the ethical thing to do; it's the intelligent thing to do. Diversity drives innovation!
The Valrose team enjoys building inclusive cultures and promoting equality for all.

Synchro Partners is partnering with a leading organisation currently undergoing a significant transformation and seeking a Senior Business Analyst with strong experience across HR systems, Finance systems, or ERP implementations.

This role will be pivotal in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions, ensuring system implementations are fit-for-purpose and deliver maximum value to the organisation. Working closely with project teams, business stakeholders, and vendors, you will play a key role in requirements gathering, process mapping, solution design, and supporting successful adoption.

Key Responsibilities:
Elicit, document, and manage business requirements from diverse stakeholder groups.
Analyse current processes, identify gaps, and design future-state workflows aligned to HR, Finance, or ERP solutions.
Translate business requirements into functional specifications for technical teams and vendors.
Support system testing activities, including test case development, execution, and defect management.
Work closely with change, training, and implementation teams to ensure smooth transition and adoption.
Facilitate workshops, meetings, and stakeholder engagement to build alignment and consensus.
Collaborate with Finance stakeholders to capture business processes, reporting needs, and compliance requirements.
Partner with HR operational teams to understand employee lifecycle processes, workforce management needs, and system dependencies.
Provide ongoing support, insights, and reporting to ensure project milestones and business outcomes are met.
Key Requirements:
Proven Business Analyst experience within large or complex organisations.
Demonstrated experience in HR, Finance, or ERP system implementations.
Strong capability in requirements gathering, process analysis, and stakeholder management.
Experience with system transformation or technology projects.
Excellent documentation, communication, and facilitation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively across business, technical, and vendor teams.
The successful candidate will bring strong business analysis expertise, a collaborative approach, and a track record of working on system transformation initiatives across HR, Finance, or ERP platforms.
If you’re looking for your next challenge and want to be part of an exciting transformation program with flexible working arrangements, apply now.

Synchro Partners by Slade Group are technology recruitment specialists. We help organisations gain competitive advantage by finding and securing exceptional technological talent.
We love partnering with clients to build high-performing teams – people who develop the best technology products, provide service excellence to their customers, and successfully deliver projects.

Our passion for people, technology, and commitment to being experts in our industry specialisations is what sets us apart in the marketplace.

Our client, a leading FMCG business, has recently implemented Power BI and is looking for an experienced Power BI Consultant to support its integration and help build out a comprehensive suite of reports.

This is a unique opportunity to work closely with the Head of FP&A as well as the full suite of Senior leaders to play a key role in shaping reporting and analytics across the business.

The Role

The client is embarking on a significant reporting uplift project, moving to Power BI. The consultant will be responsible for designing and developing a large suite of reports across all business areas including finance, sales, and operations.

Building new reports and dashboards in Power BI
Replicating and uplifting existing reports in Power BI
Working closely with the Head of FP&A to prioritise and deliver reporting requirements
Supporting the move from daily data refreshes to near real-time updates
Designing reports that incorporate internal business data, with future scope for customer/external data
Integrating third-party plugins such as Google, Facebook & Instagram advertising
Applying DAX to enhance data models and calculations
Delivering insights that support decision-making across finance, sales, and operations

About You

Strong experience in Power BI report development (including DAX and data modelling)
Strong understand and a background in accounting or finance is required
Experience with Snowflake or other data warehouse environments
Familiarity with ERP systems
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful reporting solutions
Strong communication skills and stakeholder engagement experience

Why This Role?

Play a lead role in a major reporting transformation project
Partner directly with senior leadership
Work with a modern BI environment
Exposure to a wide range of business functions and data sources
Attractive contract with the potential for extension

Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

About the company
Our client is a leading manufacturing business, currently navigating a post-acquisition phase. With a strong presence across Australia, they are entering an exciting growth journey, focused on building scale, unlocking efficiencies, and strengthening their commercial position.

About the role
This 12-month daily rate contract role reports to senior leadership, collaborating with finance, operations, and commercial sales teams. The Strategy Analyst will drive analysis and insights that shape the organisation’s growth strategy, supporting decision-making in a dynamic, post-acquisition environment.

Benefits

Daily rate contract with competitive remuneration
Opportunity to shape a major post-acquisition growth journey
Exposure to senior stakeholders across multiple functions
Flexible and collaborative work environment
Duties/Key responsibilities

Analyse financial, operational, and sales performance to identify growth opportunities
Support development of post-acquisition integration strategies
Deliver insights that influence key commercial and investment decisions
Partner with leadership teams to build scalable frameworks for sustainable growth
Skills and experience

Strong analytical ability with proven problem-solving skills
Experience in financial, operational, and commercial sales analysis
Exposure to post-acquisition or transformation environments desirable
Ability to communicate insights and influence senior stakeholders
Advanced Excel and data modelling skills 
This is a rare opportunity to join a high growth business with plenty of opportunity to progress. If you feel this role could be for you, please click ‘Apply’ today or email damien.sweeney@allurapartners.com.au
